subject: PE Today: Point, Click, Terror?
body:
CBSNews.com












Tracking Terrorists OnlineOn Friday, CBSNews.com ran 
      a story by 
      London-based producer Tucker Reals suggesting that the London bomb 
      plot might have been foretold on the Web. Public Eye spoke with Reals and his team of 
      reporters that monitor terrorist-affiliated sites, and asked 
      them what sorts of things they typically see, and how something 
      stands out from the crowd.[+ Read More]

Working 
      the PollsHow can one 
      survey be so many things to so many reporters?  This weekend, a Pew 
      survey of marriage and child rearing was released -- and what was 
      newsworthy about the poll depended entirely on where readers found out 
      about it. Public Eye took this opportunity (when there's no politics 
      involved, to fuel bias claims) to showcase how polls can be read 
      differently.[+ Read More]

Do uHate 
      iHype?It's a staple 
      of reporting on new products, particulary in the tech field:  A 
      reporter goes online to find how much the latest whizbang toy is going for 
      on eBay or other Internet auction sites.  But does an extreme asking 
      price for a Wii or an iPhone add anything to a story? Public Eye isn't so 
      sure.[+ Read More]
